result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel G Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Short-barreled Shotgun/Rifle, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.28(2).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.

No contact with any known members of the Latin Kings.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Ct. 1

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Gabriel G Ortiz in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State had no additions or corrections to PSI.   Chapter 950 not applicable.
Defense had no additions or corrections to PSI.

State recommends prison system 11 years (8 years IC and 3 years ES)
Defense requests court follow the PSI recommendation.

any psychological services provided
